title: SpectateFaker - what we learned and what we’ll do

replies.body:
Faker was being streamed against his will.
The company that "thought" they owned the rights to Faker's streams filed a complaint to riot about the streamer.

Turns out they don't own the rights, but Riot does.

Riot sided with Faker's claims that the stream was damaging to him, which is true given the influence of esport streaming on the teams finances.

Riot could have handled things slightly better.

In future, things will be handled better.

"Faker was uncomfortable about his name and gameplay being streamed without his consent"
I'm sure some of the people Faker plays with and against feel the same way, so he shouldn't be treated specially. Fuck him.
"My intent was to jump to the defense of a player (Faker) who was being singled out and streamed against his will." Everyone else Faker plays against in his stream is streamed against their will.

None of them ever complained. Also none of them were TARGETED which is the big issue here. 
You had such an intelligent post earlier, were you recently struck on the head?

Why not just make it so that spectator can't be streamed? I mean, I already know that you can't stream normal League games by normal means, and that you need specific software that taps into your graphics card to get a direct feed of the game (only while it's open mind you); would it be hard to make it so that spectated games don't appear like that?
Well, that's how you stream spectating.

Exactly. Just make it so that the spectate program does not appear as being graphically rendered according to streaming programs.

It wouldn't 100% prevent it but it would deter some people.

> [{quoted}](name=HORSE OF FORCE,realm=OCE,application-id=pEj6Ee6n,discussion-id=EEBmEQ8q,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2015-03-02T06:20:47.849+0000)
>
> Exactly. Just make it so that the spectate program does not appear as being graphically rendered according to streaming programs.
> 
> It wouldn't 100% prevent it but it would deter some people.

They pretty much just recognise programs using frameworks like DirectX or OpenGL.
Riot would need to create an entire new framework, pretty much, and people can just stream their entire screen which would just have Faker's game on it.
So no, this is not a viable solution.
**Exactly.**

I think the best approach would be a check box that hides the identity of a player that does not wish to be spectated.  It was pointed out in the post that RIOT is happy with the case where the SaltyTeemo removes the names or players.
"Here's the TL;DR" Yep, we'll just write a paragraph as the TL;DR.
GG WP Faker wins always
LOL has changed from being a game to being an international sport lol Ty RIOT
Really impressed by the maturity of this response; well thought out Riot.

In all honesty, I actually thought it was Faker himself streaming the gameplay through some alternate account or something along those lines. I actually quite enjoyed watching it, and learned some {{champion:61}} tricks off one of the times I was watching it.
However, I completely agree to take it down, and maybe I'll head over to Azubu to watch more of his stuff :)

How would they then handle games with some people who have spectating on and some with spectating off? Do they completely turn off spectate for that singular game because one of the ten players has 'spectate off'?  What about those other nine players who may (or may not) have friends or people they asked to watch them play for varying reasons?

Is this the reason why baron replays, lolreplays and LSI don't work? I've tried all nothing has worked im guessing its because of this?

sorry if its in the text tl;dr

If Azuba got the streaming rights to Faker, they should know they are not mainly getting the rights for his gameplay. They are almost SOLEY getting the rights to have his personality aka cam and reactions broadcast. If people still prefer the Twitch platform, well then you just made a bad investment and clearly don't know your audience. Azubu is a whiny bitch and this whole issue just made it WORSE for them. Idiots clearly running that company.

Riot Tryndamere is such a hypocritical person and should never have been allowed to post responses on Reddit like he did. His posts were unfiltered and gives riot a bad image. There should be consequences for his actions.

Yes, the co-founder of the company is likely to punish himself.
Hahaha don't be a clown.

Faker 4thewin
None can oppose the NINJA{{champion:238}} {{champion:84}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:98}} THEY R 2 STRONG 4 U!!!
This post gave me cancer.

HEY RIOT!! Do you think we (the fans and beloved lol players) could get another skin and champion sale calendar, it would encourage more people to buy Rp for their favourite and most desired skins and it helps your business model. (Many games with a similar business interface do have hints toward new bundles such as COD AW, Evolve and ultimate crisis and by doing so people stock up on the $$$ di get what they want) It's a Win win situation. ~ Post on any forum you can find, and let our voice be heard.
